name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Oceanfront Virginia Beach

reviews.text: I've read through other reviews on here and I have to say that I think people are acting a bit "expectant" when they should just focus on the positive. We checked in with no problems, and had a room on the ground floor, which we absolutely LOVED. Yes, the hallways are warm, but they are filled with nothing but windows for your viewing pleasure, so which is it that people want? A warm hallway with a great view, or a cold, dark hallway? The room we had was not dirty, and the staff kept it stocked with towels and cleaned every single day we stayed. Parking was crazy, I can admit that, but if you look at the overall layout and structure of the beach front, the question is could they really get around it?? The answer is NO, because the ocean front property is littered with tons of buildings and hotels. So if you're going to stay here, just realize that this is in fact a VERY touristy area, so there are not a lot of spots for parking. Angelos on the Sea was very good to us, but every persons dining experience is different. They were extremely friendly, and very accomodating to us even when we came down right before closing, which is more than I can say for Catch 31, the restaurant in the Hilton. We enjoyed this hotel very much, especially the price for ocean front property, that could not be beat! That's the whole reason we wanted to stay here in the first place, so to us if they delivered on the beautiful view ... we were sold :)
reviews.title: Location Tops Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was a good motel but pool was across the street, and the maids stole from us two times the first time they stole my bathing suit, and the second time (this was after i reported them the first time) they stole my meds and I had to go and buy more. this was the only bad thing i can say about this motel though. also remember one thing...in june are the sand soccer championships and the beach was so crowded the day we got there it was horrible, we like to have never got into our room. I will also say that our room was spectacular just dont allow the maids in there. also do not go to harpoon Larrys bar and oyster bar, these people are locales and hate tourists and were very very rude.
reviews.title: great hotel but maid stole from us twice

reviews.text: I can't complain, everything was fine from the time that we entered the hotel until we departed heading back to Lynchburg VA. The hotel room was small but cozy. Just enough room to get comfortable and that was good enough for me. The room was clean and we was on the 8th floor where we could get a nice view of most of God's beauty. The sunrise was awsome. The young lady that was cleaning the rooms was very kind with a very good attitude and was helpful in every way. 804 was our room #. So if her boss so happen to read this then.... give her a raise!! The front desk staff was nice. Everyone was just friendly. I would say that Best Western on the oceanfront is a good choice and I would choose this Hotel again!
reviews.title: I enjoyed God's beauty of the sun rise and it's reflection upon the shore

reviews.text: We stayed there from Aug. 21- 23rd, 2009. We arrived early and were able to get an early check in, which was great. The room was nice and clean, but the A/C unit was dripping water outside of almost every room. The hallways were HOT, but the rooms were cool. Parking was limited in front of Hotel ( there was more parking accross the street). The cleaning lady tried to come in before we had checked out as my daughter was getting dressed at 9:30 a.m. ( before checkout). What happen to knocking and waiting until people check out? Other than that the view was good.
reviews.title: This Hotel had some issues

reviews.text: My husband and I decided to take a weekend trip to check out Virginia Beach as we had never been there before. It was off-season and frigid but we had an amazing view of the ocean from our room. We could hear it, too, until the housecleaning staff decided to vacuum, clean and deodorize the chair cushions from our hall right in front of our room for the first 4 hours we were there! I called down to inquire when they would be done and was told "shortly." After another hour, I asked the housecleaners when they thought they'd be done with another vague answer. No worries, we thought, we'll explore the beach, head out tomorrow after a nice hot breakfast, and check out the lighthouses and natural areas. The location of the hotel is perfect, the price was good, and the room was nice, even though I found a cigarette butt under the bed. We even went swimming--the pool is okay, not heated warm enough but there's a warmer section that's supposed to be like a hot tub. We were willing to overlook what had happened until they dropped the ball again the next morning. I called about breakfast at 9:47 and was told they closed it down at 10:00. I told the woman on the phone we'd be right down. We were all ready and headed down to find the door shut and locked! We asked the front desk about it and they said it was closed. We still had almost ten minutes! They knew how upset we were and would barely look at us. We went upstairs and I called the restaurant again until someone answered just to tell them that we had counted on the breakfast as a part of the hotel price . . . very convenient! As it was, we had to take our hungry toddler elsewhere . . . though we found a fantastic restaurant because of this incident. Basically, we know it was off-season. But every person we had contact with acted like we were imposing on them somehow, with surly attitudes to match. In all the places we've stayed, we've never been treated so poorly. What should have been a relaxing off-season exploration of Virginia Beach just left a bad taste in our mouths about this hotel and what they think of their guests. Not to worry, though, we won't trouble them ever again!
reviews.title: Won't impose on this hotel again! Bad

reviews.text: This hotel was very pleasing. Great location, clean, helpful staff. Beds were very comfortable, clean, nice linens, everything worked. No complaints. Restaurant questionable. Was surprised that outside pool is across the street from the main hotel.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stay just one night of the weekend for a friend's wedding in Va Beach and we stayed at this Best Western Oceanfront and got a great deal, $91 for the night total, but it came at a price.... for one, it was across the street in what seemed to be a motel that is apparently part of the Best Western Oceanfront rooms complete with its own pool just outside my door on the 2nd (top) floor. The room was definitely not sound proof as I not only heard every sound coming from the drunks in the pool at 11pm but also the sensual sounds of the bed squeaking next door; loud and clear might I add! My girlfriend and I decided to drown out sound with louder sound so we just turned up our 2 TV's and finished watching Forrest Gump in 'ghetto' surround sound. Thankfully by 12:30 all sounds around us died out and I decided to finally get into the bed. My body still itches just thinking about how filthy that bed must have been. The moment I got into it, I was itching all over and thinking to myself, I should probably get tested for herpes after this, thankfully I was a little drunk from drinking earlier and ultimately fell asleep. I had to laugh at a sign that read "if any items are missing from bathroom, it will go on your bill"... i'm guessing their usual clientèle steals all the towels. Overall, I did not feel I was staying at a Best Western, more like a really bad Motel 6. Only redeeming factor was that there was free Wi-Fi, that is why it gets one extra point on the rating! Not worth the low prices, I will learn my lesson and pay the extra $20 for a real hotel and not a re-badged motel.
reviews.title: It's never good when your 2nd floor room smells moldy and smokey...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room here based on the Best Western reputation, but the parking (or even standing) situation here was ridiculous. When we arrived at about 7:45 PM on a Friday evening in January (the off season for this resort area), the inadequately sized parking area in front of the hotel was overflowing--all spaces filled, four cars double parked at the front door. The overflow parking garage across the street was equally jammed. The parking area itself was crowded with adults with kids milling around with no destination evident. This made reaching the hotel even more difficult. We left without checking in, rather than risking a fender bender or injury to a pedestrian. We noted when we passed the hotel the next day at 1:00 PM the parking situation didn't appear to be any better.
reviews.title: Didn't make it to check-in....

reviews.text: To wind this review up, my ratings are based on my reading other reviews of this property. My advice if you decide to stay here is (1) realize that this hotel is in a busy, overly developed resort area where parking space is obviously at a premium (2) this seems to be a family friendly hotel with lots of kids in residence. If you are looking for a quiet weekend in a resort area during the off-season, this probably wouldn't be a good choice.
reviews.title: Central location, easy to beach

reviews.text: The main hotel is oceanfront, but we were across the street in the smaller motel building. Parking was tight but available. Many restaurants around within easy walking distance. The beach was easy to get to as well. Lots of support staff around to help, though cleaning took way too long so we finally asked them not to do it. If the price is right, stay here and don't worry about it.
reviews.title: Location is Awesome, A Bit Pricey, But That's the Atlantic Right There!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend & I recently stayed here (Aug 13th-15th). We were only there for 2 days, wish we would have stayed a day longer though. I must admit after reading all the reviews I was a little aprehensive about staying here...but upon arrving at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. We didnt get there til around 5pm, and we got a parking spot right outside the hotel, which was great, since alot of people said parking was really tight. We stayed on the 6th floor of the oceanfront hotel. The room was nice and clean, and the view was awesome! The only problem was the toilet kept running, but didnt really bother us too much...had no problems sleeping...lol. We did eat dinner at the restaurant in the hotel, good food, prices were bad either, and the drinks are good as well...gotta try the strawberry daquari...so good. We also ate at breakfast at Pochantas Pancakes (35th st), good selection of food, and prices were resaonable as well, and did dine at Murphy's Irish Bar...we thought the place was just ok, but food was good. The weather was ok...it was overcast most of the time, but at least the rain held off at nite, and than cleared up, and than of course as we were leaving the sun came out...lol. I cant wait to come back again, and definitely stay longer, so we can enjoy the beach, and fly our kite, and go jet skiing and/or parasailing...lol. :)
reviews.title: Great view, Great price!

reviews.text: I wont bore you with much, we got there late and we got the 3rd floor room, we wanted higher but it was very booked. We went to the room worried and we were pleasantly surprised. The view was excellent it's on the perfect part of the beach everthing was clean. I mean it wasnt spotless but clean bed and sheets were fine; bathroom was fine as well.
reviews.title: Excellent place for the price

reviews.text: Make sure you ask for an ocean front room because if you dont you will end up in the other little hotel they have thats NOT on the beach and it looks like you can get robbed at any moment (SERIOUSLY). The check in took moments and it was fine. If you get a parking spot in front of the hotel go play the lotto right after cause that is hard to do LOL. Anyways you can park across the street be careful with SUV's it's tigh fight the higher you go. I will say this, they post a guard at the parking deck from i think 11pm - 5am. I thought that was great !
reviews.title: A Pleasant Stay in VA Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fine, I did not eat at the restaurant below but they are close to alot of things and all the street performances are just a few mins walk from the hotel. I would go back the price is right and i didnt live in my room we went out and enjoyed the beach and attractions. Oh they also had free wireless internet and it moved pretty fast so that was a plus for when i was in the room.
reviews.title: Convenient location and best price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I posted couple pics below of the room see for yourself it's just fine (for the price)
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The Best Western Oceanfront was a good place for our family vacation. We stayed 5 nights and liked the location of the hotel as it was right on the boardwalk and we had an ocean view room (be careful that you don't get the standard non-ocean view rooms across the street on Atlantic Ave, as I wouldn't have wanted to stay there. They didn't have balconies and NO ocean view at all, just a view of their little outdoor pool.). But we stayed in the ocean view rooms on the 7th floor. The only real complaints I had about this hotel was that the elevators needed servicing (4 elevators that were working when we got there on Monday, but only 2 were working when we left yesterday on Saturday when it was the busiest time). Parking right in front of the hotel is probably not going to happen but it takes only a minute to use the parking garage, and those slots at least are shaded! We saw one guy make his wife stand in a parking spot in front of the hotel for like 10 minutes while he was doing something with the car (we couldn't figure out what) and she actually stood there...guarding off people like they'd have to run her over to park there. Absurd really...it didn't take any time at all to walk across the street! And if you are loading/unloading bags, you have room to do that without even finding a spot, you just pull in and unload at the front door. It really wasn't that big of a hardship...
reviews.title: Adequate rooms, great location, satisfied!

reviews.text: The plumbing worked great (I always worry about that in large hotels), showers were consistent, hot, and nice. Housekeeping is sort of slow but it was so HOT there this past week that I didn't blame them any. It was just hard to "chill" in the room in the aftrnoon when they were going to be coming in to clean any second...at 3:30 pm...
reviews.title: Perfect vacation!

reviews.text: I thought all the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Great Room for the Price

reviews.text: One warning of the area (this was our first visit to VA), we thought the food pricing was expensive. Our first night we didn't know where to go so the hotel recommended Captain George's Seafood Buffet off of Laskin Ave. When we got there, it took a stand in line to get seated...and then we were told it was $28 a plate....and only my husband and I even liked seafood. But we took it anyway ( two kids suffered thru it). For that kind of price, for a buffet, per person....I would have really expected higher quality. I guess if you want to eat your fill of crab legs, you MIGHT get your money's worth after fighting the crowd and getting what you want from the buffet...but I just wouldn't waste the money or time! I seriously left hungry. Not what we were expecting for our first night there.
reviews.title: Would Stay Again

reviews.text: We bought beach chairs and an umbrella across the street at one of the beach stores...cheaper than renting on the beach. AND cheaper than the super K-Mart nearby.
reviews.title: Nice room, but no breakfast and few TV channels

aka: Best Western Plus Oceanfront Virginia Beach Hotel
description: The BEST WESTERN PLUS offers several types of accommodations from which to choose. Enjoy a stunning view from one of our 166 oceanfront rooms with private balconies, double- or king-size beds and optional jacuzzi. Easy beach access is also available from our location right across the street, our non-oceanfront rooms feature 40 rooms with double-size beds as well as eight two-room suites with one queen bed. All rooms are non-smoking and provide refrigerators, coffee makers and complimentary wireless service for your added convenience.One parking space available per reserved room
